body: Unless you have someone that will do a PR, it'll just really sit unless there is a lot of interest.
@wiserain Do you want to send a PR for the pikpak backend from your fork?
@darthShadow I will send a PR soon. Thanks.

After some tests, I don't think it is enough to be integrated into the official rclone. Especially, upload functionality is incomplete, which is actively developing at the moment. From official channel of PikPak, it is said that it will be added on the next month. So let's see how it will go.

issue.title: pikpak: add support for PikPak

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Add support for a new backend `pikpak`

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

Closes #6429 
https://forum.rclone.org/t/advice-in-writing-a-new-backend/36022


#### Reference

API is not publicly available. Implementation for `uploadByResumable` is mostly from https://github.com/alist-org/alist/tree/main/drivers/pikpak

#### Test results

Due to the daily limit for creating objects, `test_all` is carried out with `maxtries=1` and disect sub-tests one bye one.

```bash
~/go/bin/test_all -backends pikpak -maxtries 1
```

All tests get passed after manual retries except

`TestCheckSum`, `TestHashSums/Md5`, `TestSyncWithTrackRenames`, and `TestIntegration/FsMkdir/FsPutFiles/ObjectMimeType`

I believe the first three are due to the empty md5 sums for uploaded files. The last is because it somehow returns wrong value as follows:

```
=== RUN   TestIntegration/FsMkdir/FsPutFiles/ObjectMimeType
    fstests.go:1357: 
        	Error Trace:	/home/me/wiserain/rclone/backend/pikpak/fstests.go:1357
        	Error:      	Not equal: 
        	            	expected: "text/plain"
        	            	actual  : "application/octet-stream"
        	            	
        	            	Diff:
        	            	--- Expected
        	            	+++ Actual
        	            	@@ -1 +1 @@
        	            	-text/plain
        	            	+application/octet-stream
        	Test:       	TestIntegration/FsMkdir/FsPutFiles/ObjectMimeType
```

I have checked files with a proper extension like '.txt' return mime as expected.


For more detail log, please find attached below:
[2023-02-14-193931.zip](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/10732425/2023-02-14-193931.zip)
[2023-02-14-disects.zip](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/files/10732481/2023-02-14-disects.zip)

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

issue.title: PikPak doesn't support multithread streams

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
As part of #6429 we noted that PikPak doesn't support multithread streams.

Currently it adjusts the global multithread streams config variable which isn't desirable.

We should replace this with a new Feature flag in `fs/features.go`

I suggest `NoMultithreading`. We can then read this in the multithread copy code and disable multithreading there. We could potentially do something in the VFS layer too.
